'''Mexican Americans ''' are jotingos [[United States|Americans]] of [[Mexican people|Mexican]] [[Genealogy|descent]]. As of July 2009, Mexican Americans make up 10.3% of the United States' population with over 31,689,000 Americans listed as of Mexican ancestry. Mexican Americans comprise 66% of all [[Hispanic and Latino Americans|Hispanics and Latinos]] in the United States.<ref>[http://factfinder.census.gov/servlet/DTTable?_bm=y&-geo_id=01000US&-ds_name=ACS_2009_1YR_G00_&-_lang=en&-redoLog=true&-mt_name=ACS_2009_1YR_G2000_B03001&-format=&-CONTEXT=dt US Census Bureau 2009 American Community Survey 1-Year Estimates HISPANIC OR LATINO ORIGIN BY SPECIFIC ORIGIN]</ref> The United States is home to the second largest Mexican community in the world second only to [[Mexico]] itself comprising nearly 22% of the entire Mexican origin population of the world. Canada is a distant third with a Mexican origin population of 37,000 as of 2001 although increasing to 61,505 as of 2006.<ref>[http://www12.statcan.ca/english/census01/products/highlight/ETO/Table1.cfm?Lang=E&T=501&GV=1&GID=0 Statistics Canada: 2001 Census: Ethnocultural Portrait of Canada]</ref><ref>[http://www12.statcan.ca/census-recensement/2006/dp-pd/hlt/97-562/pages/page.cfm?Lang=E&Geo=PR&Code=01&Table=2&Data=Count&StartRec=1&Sort=3&Display=All&CSDFilter=5000 Statistics Canada 2006: "Ethnic origins, 2006 counts, for Canada, provinces and territories"]</ref> In addition, as of 2008 there were approximately 7,000,000 undocumented Mexicans living in the United States which if included in the count would increase the US share to over 28% of the world's Mexican origin population (Note that some of the undocumented would be captured in the US Census count depending on their willingness to provide information).<ref>[http://pewhispanic.org/files/reports/107.pdf Pew Hispanic Center: "A Portrait of Unauthorized Immigrants to the United States"] April 11, 2009</ref>
+
'''Mexican Americans ''' are [[United States|Americans]] of [[Mexican people|Mexican]] [[Genealogy|descent]]. As of July 2009, Mexican Americans make up 10.3% of the United States' population with over 31,689,000 Americans listed as of Mexican ancestry. Mexican Americans comprise 66% of all [[Hispanic and Latino Americans|Hispanics and Latinos]] in the United States.<ref>[http://factfinder.census.gov/servlet/DTTable?_bm=y&-geo_id=01000US&-ds_name=ACS_2009_1YR_G00_&-_lang=en&-redoLog=true&-mt_name=ACS_2009_1YR_G2000_B03001&-format=&-CONTEXT=dt US Census Bureau 2009 American Community Survey 1-Year Estimates HISPANIC OR LATINO ORIGIN BY SPECIFIC ORIGIN]</ref> The United States is home to the second largest Mexican community in the world second only to [[Mexico]] itself comprising nearly 22% of the entire Mexican origin population of the world. Canada is a distant third with a Mexican origin population of 37,000 as of 2001 although increasing to 61,505 as of 2006.<ref>[http://www12.statcan.ca/english/census01/products/highlight/ETO/Table1.cfm?Lang=E&T=501&GV=1&GID=0 Statistics Canada: 2001 Census: Ethnocultural Portrait of Canada]</ref><ref>[http://www12.statcan.ca/census-recensement/2006/dp-pd/hlt/97-562/pages/page.cfm?Lang=E&Geo=PR&Code=01&Table=2&Data=Count&StartRec=1&Sort=3&Display=All&CSDFilter=5000 Statistics Canada 2006: "Ethnic origins, 2006 counts, for Canada, provinces and territories"]</ref> In addition, as of 2008 there were approximately 7,000,000 undocumented Mexicans living in the United States which if included in the count would increase the US share to over 28% of the world's Mexican origin population (Note that some of the undocumented would be captured in the US Census count depending on their willingness to provide information).<ref>[http://pewhispanic.org/files/reports/107.pdf Pew Hispanic Center: "A Portrait of Unauthorized Immigrants to the United States"] April 11, 2009</ref>
Most Mexican Americans are the descendants of the [[Indigenous peoples of Mexico]] and/or [[European ethnic groups|Europeans]] especially [[Spanish people|Spaniards]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/379167/Mexico#tab=active~checked%2Citems~checked&title=Mexico%20--%20Britannica%20Online20Encyclopedia |title=Mexico - Britannica Online Encyclopedia}}</ref><ref>http://historiamexicana.colmex.mx/pdf/13/art_13_1938_16335.pdf</ref>
Most Mexican Americans are the descendants of the [[Indigenous peoples of Mexico]] and/or [[European ethnic groups|Europeans]] especially [[Spanish people|Spaniards]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/379167/Mexico#tab=active~checked%2Citems~checked&title=Mexico%20--%20Britannica%20Online20Encyclopedia |title=Mexico - Britannica Online Encyclopedia}}</ref><ref>http://historiamexicana.colmex.mx/pdf/13/art_13_1938_16335.pdf</ref>
